website_summaries.verdict: So iLL shoemakers have done a super-fine job making the Street. Indeed, they were able to create a looker that sticks to virtually everything and anything. Their genius also led to the Street as being one of the most comfortable bouldering kicks out there.That said, they could have looked for ways to make the shoe in question stink-proof. Nonetheless, the Street is an incredible piece in both function and form.
pros: Multiple sources say that the So iLL Street climbing shoe has A-grade surface traction
This fantastic rock shoe has head-turning aesthetics, according to numerous reviewers
Based on several reports, the Street excels in ascending boulders
It is quite comfortable for an aggressive shoe, claim a handful of folks who have bought it
Some of those who have given the So iLL Street a try find its fit true to size
Its toe-hooking prowess is remarkable, a couple of testers say
cons: The Street from So iLL can get really stinky, based on a small number of reviews
Its rather demanding asking price might be a little too much for some buyers
According to a few wearers, this So iLL offering has a sloppy heel zone

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed with my first So iLL purchase
customer_reviews.text: Had to exchange shoes twice because of sizing issues. I wear a Women's 6.5 and finally ended with a 5.5, but the shoe tag says 4.5? While the toe box is very tight, the heel seems to rub quite a bit. And after climbing in them for two weeks, the rubber on the toe box is already detached itself from the fabric and I haven't climbed hard in them at all. While very aesthetically pleasing, I wish I would have gone with something else. Disappointed with my first So iLL purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Ctorres0494

customer_reviews.title: Initially painful but they broke in quickly
customer_reviews.text: Initially painful but they broke in quickly. The Street is comfortable for a climbing shoe. The shoe being all black and synthetic caught my eye. I've worn them indoors and outdoors. In both environments they work amazingly. The rubber is super sticky and gives you the confidence to smear as you please. I feel way more confident while in these shoes. Maybe it's a placebo effect, but I've been sending problems I couldn't before. I'm by no means a professional climber, but I really like them. My only complaint is that they do stink after a bit. It is my understanding that this is very common with synthetic shoes though.
customer_reviews.author: michael mayorga

customer_reviews.title: Extremely happy. Ordered them a size up from street shoes ...
customer_reviews.text: Extremely happy. Ordered them a size up from street shoes as they recommend and they fit as expected. I think a lot of people who are rating these low are neglecting to realize a climbing shoe this aggressive is typically a little tighter than others.
customer_reviews.author: mab233tx

customer_reviews.title: So ill's Size Recommendation Spot On
customer_reviews.text: For men, So iLL recommends a 1/2 size up from street shoes size. Typically you size down climbing shoes, so I was skeptical about So iLL's sizing. I ordered a 10 since my street shoe size is a 10 and I currently wear a 9.5 evolv climbing shoe. So iLL's sizing was spot on. The 10 was far too tight so I ordered a 10.5 and found that the fit was much better.
customer_reviews.author: Robert I.

customer_reviews.title: It has been 9 months and there is already a hole in my right shoe.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this pair of shoes in October and am reviewing this in July - it has been 9 months and there is already a hole in my right shoe. It’s unfortunate because the shape and fit was great, but I expected more use out of this before it gave out. I climb about twice a week, and this pair was used purely for indoor bouldering in intermediate routes (V5 and under). My last pair of shoes (Scarpa) lasted for 3 years including several outdoor climbs.
customer_reviews.author: Pangu

customer_reviews.title: Sizing is SO OFF
customer_reviews.text: I wasted my money. I ordered a whole size down like suggested buying a 5.5 instead of my typical 6.5. after a month and half they still have not stretch out at all. I also sprained one of my ankles with these shoes on from the lack of support that they have. While they are good for cracked climbing in general they are so painful and uncomfortable. I'm over also disappointed in these shoes and really just feel like I wasted my money.
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: SoIll rocks!
customer_reviews.text: I love these shoes. I normally wear a size 6 in women’s so I have to go down to a 5.
customer_reviews.author: Arianna Fenimore

customer_reviews.title: Shoe size too small
customer_reviews.text: I followed the sizing instructions exactly as the So Ill website said to do and the shoes I ordered are way to small. To the point that I can not wear them. If I order another pair from So Ill I will order the same shoe size as my street shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Finally found my climbing shoe :)
customer_reviews.text: After 5 sessions of climbing in the gym the shoe feels great and broken in. Great grip and good performance.
customer_reviews.author: Tomer

customer_reviews.title: Worst climbing shoes I've had
customer_reviews.text: The fit was actually perfect but that's not useful if the shoe itself won't last even 3 months, I bought these shoes because they look great and let's face it they do have good marketing and advertising but they are JUST NOT WORTH IT, they started coming apart on less than 3 months, I gave SO I'LL my opinion and they didn't even do **** about it, they actually said that they don't give any warranty if it has been more than a month. JUST NOT WORTH IT.
customer_reviews.author: Jean

customer_reviews.title: Solid shoe.
customer_reviews.text: Ordered a half size up from my street shoe size and they fit well. They took about a week of climbing 4 days a week for about 2-4 hours at a time to break in. Overall a great aggressive shoe that sticks well in any situation. Keep in mind these are aggressive shoes and will be tight in certain spots.
customer_reviews.author: steven

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Holes in the big toes started to form after 5 months of exclusive gym bouldering.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

product_meta.title: So iLL The Street Climbing Shoe
product_meta.description: Inspired by everyday classic footwear, the Street is a faultless blend of fashion and function. Our softest, aggressive shoe in the line was designed with synthetic materials for minimal stretch. An ultra thin midsole provides a softer more sensitive fit, creating an extremely lightweight aggressive climbing shoe. We suggest guys order a half size up from street shoe size to give a tight and functional fit and ladies order one size down from street shoe size for a tight, functional fit.
